credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Project for a back panel of a coach
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Brush and gray watercolor, pen and ink, black chalk
description: Very rickly decorated.  Poseidon riding over the dea is shown in the upper panel, Hercules slaying the Hydra in the lower one.  Parts of the supporting leather belts are shown below.
name: Drawing
